### GIS

GIS is the abbreviation for Geographic Information System. 

It is a computer-based tool for collecting, storing, processing, analysing, visualising and interpreting spatially referenced data.

GIS is a useful tool to help answer geographic questions and make decisions.

### GIS

Example usage: 

- Climatologists to understand the causes and consequences of climate change

- Political consultants to develop campaign strategies for elections

- Epidemiologists to locate ground zero of a disease outbreak

In 1854 Doctor John Snow mapped the cases of the deadly cholera epidemic in London's Broad Street region and was able to trace the cholera outbreak to a single infected water pump. Snow's research was the first example of combining public health research and geography.
